title: MUSIAL Variants Dictionary
description: Storage of (coding gene) features located on a single locus, their nucleotide variants, the induced amino acid mutations and information about the protein product of the respective feature.

parameters.description: Parameters used to infer nucleotide variants, i.e. all stored variants comply with the parameters in at least one sample.

minCoverage.description: The minimal depth of coverage wrt. reads of a variant to be accepted.

minFrequency.description: The minimal frequency wrt. reads supporting a homozygous allele call for a variant to be accepted.

minHetFrequency.description: The minimal frequency wrt. reads supporting a heterozygous allele call for a variant to be accepted.

maxHetFrequency.description: The maximal frequency wrt. reads supporting a heterozygous allele call for a variant to be accepted.

minQuality.description: The minimal call quality for a variant to be accepted.

features.description: Stores pattern properties associated with a single (coding gene) feature. The key of each feature defines the internal gene name and stores an object.

^.+$.description: Information about a single (coding gene) feature stored as `object`.

name.description: The internal gene name; has to be equal to the key at which this object is stored.

nucleotideSequence.description: The nucleotide sequence of the (coding gene) feature.

chromosome.description: The name of the locus this feature is located on. Should equal the value of `chromosome` of the parent object of this feature.

start.description: The 1-based start position of the (coding gene) feature on its locus

end.description: The 1-based end position of the (coding gene) feature on its locus

isSense.description: Whether the (coding gene) feature is encoded on the sense or antisense strand.

allocatedProtein.description: Information about the protein product of this feature and how it is affected by recorded variants.

name.description: The internal name of the protein.

pdb.description: File content of a `pdb` format file of the allocated proteins structure.

chainSequences.description: The reference amino acid sequence of protein per chain.

^[A-Z]{1}$.description: Reference amino acid sequence of a single chain. Lower case substrings are translated from the genes sequence but were not included in the `pdb` format file.

proteoforms.description: Proteoforms with respect to the translated (coding gene) feature nucleotide sequence. Keys used to store proteoforms represent a hash encoding of the proteoforms sequence concatenated with `x` and the percentage of alternate positions wrt. the reference.

^[-]?[0-9]+x[0-1]{1}\\.[0-9]{2}$.description: Information about a single proteoform allocated to exactly one (coding gene) feature stored as `object`.

name.description: The internal proteoform name; has to be equal to the key at which this object is stored.

annotations.description: Any `string` type key/value pairs yielding meta-information about the feature.

vSwab.description: String representation of all variants occuring in this proteoform.

samples.description: List of all samples names that cause this proteoform.

items.description: Items have to match keys of the `samples` property.

variants.description: Information about amino acid variants stored in a nested object structure.

^[0-9]+(\\+|-)[0.9]+$.description: The position of the variant/mutation on the protein sequence concatenated with how many positions are added (+) or removed (-) by this mutation.

^[ARNDCEQGHILKMFPSTWYVX*]+$.description: The alternate amino acid sequence of the variant. May include `-` for gaps and stores the content of the `position` inclusively.

annotations.description: Any `string` type key/value pairs yielding meta-information about the variant.

cause.description: String representation of all nucleotide variants that cause this amino acid mutation(s).

occurrence.description: List of all proteoforms names that yield this variant.

items.description: Items have to match keys of the `proteoforms` property.

annotations.description: Any `string` type key/value pairs yielding meta-information about the feature.

^.+$.description: Meta-information about the feature. The property `geneName` (the value of the `name` attribute of the feature in the used `GFF` file of the parent locus).

samples.description: Information about samples, i.e. possibly deviating genotypes of any of the stored features.

^.+$.description: Information about a single sample stored as `object`.

name.description: The internal sample name; has to be equal to the key at which this object is stored.

annotations.description: Any `string` type key/value pairs yielding meta-information about the sample.

^.+vSwab$.description: String representation of all variants occuring in this sample. Keys have to match #vSwab where # is the internal name of any stored feature.

software.description: The software with which the variants dictionary was computed.

date.description: The date at which the variants dictionary was computed.

chromosome.description: The locus/chromosome on which all stored (coding gene) features are located at.

variants.description: Information about nucleotide variants stored in a nested object structure.

^[0-9]+$.description: The position of the variant on the parent locus.

^[ACGTN-]+$.description: The alternate nucleotide sequence of the variant. May include `-` for gaps and stores the content of the `position` inclusively.

annotations.description: Any `string` type key/value pairs yielding meta-information about the variant.

^.+_EFF$.description: Special annotation property reflecting the `|` separated fields Annotation, Putative_impact, and HGVS.p coding of a SnpEff annotation. Keys have to match #_EFF where # is the value of a `annotations`/`geneName` property of any stored feature.

occurrence.description: Yields key/value pairs indicating the occurence of this variant in a specific sample as well as meta-information of this occurence. Each key should be equal to exactly one key in `samples`.
